meanings.definition: A vertical bar between the panes of a window or the panels of a screen.
meanings.sent1: The old house had beautiful mullions on its windows.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate design of the mullions in the church's stained glass windows.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to climb the mullions but got stuck halfway.
meanings.sent4: The mullions in the window seemed to hold secrets of the past within their frames.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight filtered through the mullions, casting patterns on the floor.

meanings.definition: To divide or separate with mullions.
meanings.sent1: The architect decided to mullion the large window to create smaller sections.
meanings.sent2: They mullioned the room to give each person their own private space.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully mullioned the cake into individual slices for the guests.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to mullion the group, creating tension among them.
meanings.sent5: The river mullioned the land, creating distinct islands in its path.
